author: bridge-bot
content:
<mratsim> This one: https://hackmd.io/@protolambda/blobs_l2_tx_usage (re @rudolf6: Maybe this from eip4844.com

https://hackmd.io/@protolambda/eip-4844-implementer-notes)

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> the opcode was renamed from DATAHASH to BLOBHASH, and the blob-tx details changed a bit w.r.t. blob-fee param names, and the blob-count per block changed to 3 iirc, but the general diagrams all still apply. (re @gakonst: <@203220829473996800> these up to date?)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<protolambda> (edit: meant to tag the implementer-notes hackmd) This one is more outdated. Back then there weren't as productionized KZG libs. If you work with KZG as L2 user now I recommend using https://github.com/ethereum/c-kzg-4844 or https://github.com/crate-crypto/go-kzg-4844  instead of my old KZG experimental code (re @rudolf6: Maybe this from eip4844.com

https://hackmd.io/@protolambda/eip-4844-implementer-notes)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<mratsim> I also provide my own with C, Nim, Go and Rust API since a month ago.

Waiting on differential fuzzing (https://github.com/mratsim/constantine/pull/318 )

And independent benches are likely updated with it soon: https://github.com/sifraitech/rust-kzg/pull/254 (re @protolambda: (edit: meant to tag the implementer-notes hackmd) This one is more outdated. Back then there weren't as productionized KZG libs. If you work with KZG as L2 user now I recommend using https://github.com/ethereum/c-kzg-4844 or https://github.com/crate-crypto/go-kzg-4844  instead of my old KZG experimental code)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<adietrichs> Announcement post for next week's 4844 testing breakout call: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/rollcall-breakout-1-eip-4844-readiness-check/18226
Zoom link will be shared here closer to the call.

I left the agenda pretty open for now, let me know (ideally with a comment in that thread) if there are specific topics you would like to discuss on that call!

author: bridge-bot
content:
<adietrichs> e.g. in case people want to talk about this on the call (re @ethrnd_rollcall_bot: <ryanleeschneider> In the Zoom chat on https://www.youtube.com/live/FhMBatolkOM?si=I1_EUZCabCKVK_Hf&t=1037 <@486477492434239488> mentioned:

>  Would be useful for L2s to have a guide / template "here is how to integrate blob data verification*
> Or a "blob integration guide" of sorts

Are there any documents like that available?  I'm asking since I'm still a bit unclear on what the "typical" blob workflow will look like so would be very interested in reading anything along those lines.)

content:

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Yes! This is what I was looking for thanks!
